attributes.action: Upgrade the 10 Downing Street E-Petitions Website To A Permanent Facility For the Expression of Public Opinion Instead of Remaining Classified Only As a "BETA TEST"
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The 10 Downing St E-Petitions Website has become a popular and extremely well publicised facility for the expression of concern about popular issues of the day by the UK general public.

The website has proven that it is both stable and reliable enough to handle very large volumes of online web signatures in a short period, as for instance in the case of the petition against the proposed introduction of national road pricing by the government.  With that being so there do not seem to be any obvious remaining issues that justify the continued classification of the petitions website by the Prime Minister's office as being only a "BETA TEST" instead of a full blown and permanently established and properly publicised alternative to and/or replacement for conventional paper based petitions to the government.

The Prime Minister is therefore urged to upgrade the E-Petitions Website from "BETA TEST" to permanently established status at the earliest possible opportunity
